SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Levels

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Object
LevelParent class represents parent class for all levels in game. LevelParent is an abstract class which provides common functionality for managing game levels, including initialising game scene, handling game logic, and managing actors.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth, Controller controller, ComponentsFactory componentsFactory, AssetFactory assetFactory, AudioManager audioManager)
      Constructs new LevelParent instance. Initialises level with its background image, screen dimensions, player health and other dependencies.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - : name of background image for the level.
      screenHeight - : height of screen.
      screenWidth - : width of screen.
      playerInitialHealth - : initial health of the player.
      controller - : controller which manages the game flow.
      componentsFactory - : ComponentsFactory used for components creation.
      assetFactory - : AssetsFactory used for assets creation.
      audioManager - : AudioManager for playing audio.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected abstract void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initialises the player's plane for the level. Method that must be implemented by subclasses.

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks if game is over based on the player's status and number of kills. Method that must be implemented by subclasses.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected abstract void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units at regular intervals. Method that must be implemented by subclasses.

      Instantiates level view, which includes the game screen and UI elements. Method that must be implemented by subclasses.
      Returns:
      LevelScreen instance representing level view.

    • getKillTarget

      protected abstract int getKillTarget()

      Returns:
      kill target.

      Starts game by requesting focus and playing timeline.

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Restarts the game by stopping the timeline, clearing the root, resetting the player's health and kills, and reinitialising friendly units.
